sect1.title: Partitioning
sect1.para: &sles4sap; creates the partitioning table in two stages:

listitem.para: (during the installation of the operating system)

sect2.title: Partitioning for the Operating System (stage 1)
sect2.para: During the installation of the operating system, partitions for the operating system are created.
A logical volume group (LVG) named /dev/system will be created. This LVG contains two logical volumes (LVs):

listitem.para: /dev/system/root: by default 60 GB to account for the operating system and &sap; media
/dev/system/swap: by default 2 GB, avoid setting a smaller size. See also SAP Note 1984787: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12: Installation notes ().

sect2.para: Additionally, a boot or UEFI partition will be created as necessary.

sect2.title: Partitioning for the &sap; System (stage 2)
sect2.para: The partitioning for the &sap; system can be created by:

This part of the partitioning can only be created after the operating system has been installed. That means the partitions are created either in the installation workflow after the reboot or in the running system.
Depending on the product you are installing and your particular use case, the amount of hard disk space necessary can vary.
